intro: Setcreasea australis, commonly known as the Australian flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its large, showy red or orange flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant has compound leaves composed of several oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species. Setcreasea australis is often cultivated for its striking floral display and adaptability to various climates.
